1.content:
Carey set the last plate of food down on the kitchen table, and took her seat.

Zack immediately started helping himself to the huge bowl of mashed potatoes, while Cody fixed himself a nice plate of broccoli and a piece of steak.

“Mom, there’s nothing to drink!” Zack complained, looking down at his lonely mountain of mashed potatoes.

Carey pushed the bottle of cranberry juice over to her son. “Here’s an idea, Zack, try some cranberry juice.”

Zack looked at her as if she were stupid. “Again I say, mom, there’s nothing to drink!”

Cody rolled his eyes, and started to pour his own glass of juice. “Cranberry juice is good for your urinary track,” He informed his brother.

Zack stared at his brother with a look of disbelief. “I’m glad we’re having this conversation!” He forced a sarcastic smile, and then dug his fork into the heap of mashed potatoes.

Cody just shrugged.

“You know, your brother’s right, and not only that, he knows how to eat healthy. I’ve noticed lately that you’ve been gorging on all that junk food.” Carey looked back over at Zack’s place at the table, which was now empty.

He had wandered over to the refrigerator, and was digging through it. Zack reappeared from inside of it, and said, “What are you talking about, mom?” Then, opened the can of pop, he was holding and took a long swig.

“Exhibit A,” Carey pointed to her son, as he sat back down at the table. “What kids drink pop for dinner?” She asked, more of a question for Cody than Zack.

“What boobs” Cody replied, happily, prodding one of Zack's slight man boobs, that were developing

Zack shot his brother one of those I-can’t-believe-you’re-on-her-side looks. “What do you know, Cody? Other than, ‘cranberry juice is good for your urinary track’!” He said, mimicking the way his twin had said it.

“Just leave your brother alone, Zack. Not only does he know how to eat healthy, unlike you, he also cares deeply about proper bodily functions,” Carey explained.

“Uh yeah, and there’s nothing wrong with that!” Cody reminded Zack, who just slapped his hand to his forehead, embarrassed of his dork of a brother.

Carey shoved the bowl of broccoli across the table to Zack. “Here, have some broccoli,” She offered.

Cody sat upright in his seat, and grinned. “Broccoli is good for your bowels!” He added.

Zack smirked. “Again, I’m glad we’re having this conversation!”

[Later that day]

Zack was practically passed out on the couch, in front of the TV, empty snack containers, and bags of chips strewn across him and the couch. His eyelids were beginning to feel heavy, and the weight of all that food he had just stuffed himself with was pinning him down to the couch. Zack knew that if he tried to move, his full stomach would ache even more.

He weakly reached over and grabbed the chip bag. Bringing it up to his face, he emptied the remaining contents into his mouth.

Just then, the door to the suite opened, and in strolled Cody, his usual smile plastered to his face, until he saw the mess in the living room and scowled. “Zack, what do you think you’re doing?”

“Binging on junk food,” Zack mumbled, as if the answer were obvious, which it was, considering the mess he had left of the couch.

Cody looked shocked. “Why, Zack? There has to be something you can do to stop these horrid eating habits. It’s an awful waste of energy and free time!” He shouted, bringing out a giant garbage bag, and hurrying over to Zack’s mess.

Zack sat up with a groan, as his stomach ache settled in. “Well, excuse me you cranberry juice and broccoli lover, math whiz, sweater vest-wearing, doofus!” He said, taking a long breath after saying of all that.

Cody frowned. “Well I’m not the one cleaning up the mess you made!” He glanced down, and realized that he had started tossing the empty junk food container and chip bags into the trash bag he was holding. He dropped it, and looked over at Zack. “Here you do it! It’s your mess to clean up!” And with that, he headed back into the kitchen, and dumped the contents of his backpack onto the table.

Zack looked over at his brother sympathetically. “Cody, what’s wrong? You always do homework when you’re upset.”

Cody opened his notebook and sighed. “Well, I could ask you the same question. You overeat when you’re upset, even though you don’t realize you’re doing it,” He explained.

“Really” Zack questioned, quizzically. “I don’t feel upset.”

“You may not feel upset, but obviously something is bothering you, and that’s why you’ve been doing this for the last few days. Now tell me, what’s on your mind?” Cody asked, calmly folding and resting his hands on the table in front of him.

Zack looked at his brother oddly. He wasn’t sure if he would ever understand how his crazy mind worked. “You sound like my psychiatrist,” He told Cody.

Cody grinned, and sat up straighter in the chair. “You see one, too?”

Zack shook his head, sarcastically.

Cody frowned and shrunk back into his chair. “N - Not the point,” He muttered.

“Well then what is the point, Cody? ‘Cause, you lost me here!” Zack said from the couch.

It wasn’t too often that Zack felt he had to look after his brother, but then again, Cody always seemed to be lost, and not getting anywhere without Zack’s help. Even though Cody was the smart and sensitive twin, Zack was still the older and in his eyes, cooler. Zack found nothing cool about being nice all the time and wearing those goofy sweater vests that Cody always wore.

“Look, man – it’s not too often that I would say something like this, but here it goes -.” Zack jumped up from his seat on the couch, and pointed at his brother. “Get some help!”

Cody looked over at Zack. “I’m not the one that has to fill up on sweets and junk food just to relieve stress!”

“You think I’m relieving stress?” Zack screamed. “Let me tell you this, little brother – eating does not relieve stress at all! If anything, it adds even more!”

“Then why do you do it?” Cody shot back.

Zack didn’t answer that one.

“Zack, for crying out loud, look at you!” Cody stood up, too.

“No one’s crying out loud!” Zack huffed.

“Yes, you are!” Cody fired back.

Zack threw himself back down on the couch, and crossed him arms over his chest.

Cody was already starting to calm down a bit. “Look, Zack, my point is – as your brother, I only want you to start eating a little healthier, okay? I’m not asking for you to change those habits all at once, but can’t you at least cut back on the snacks?”

Zack brought a cookie he had picked up from the couch, up to his mouth, and stopped as he heard those words. “Okay, starting with this cookie!” He angrily shoved it into the garbage bag at his feet, and dusted his hands off, as if he had just finished dirty work.

Cody smiled over at his brother. “There we go. That’s all I’m asking!” He looked back down at his homework, and prepared to start it.

Zack was still seated on the couch, next to a plastic tray of mini doughnuts. He silently eased his hand over to the sweets, and poked his index finger through the hole in one of the doughnuts, and quietly brought it up to his face. He just couldn’t resist junk foods. But, of course since his brother was so harsh about things like that, he had to be certain that Cody didn’t see him eating more junk.

Even though he didn’t look up from his homework, Cody still shook his head. “I saw that.”

Zack let out a long wail of defeat, and let the doughnut fall from his hands. “Come on, man. I didn’t think you were serious! I just can’t give up junk food! I mean – it’s everywhere!” He looked to his left on the couch, and grabbed the doughnut tray. Within half a second, Zack had stuffed most of the doughnuts into his mouth.

Cody just glared at him, disgusted. “Your loss” He warned.



[Who's version of the story do you want to see? Zack? or Cody? or both?]

"We were at the doctors two months ago" said Cody. "I was one hundred and twenty eight pounds, you were one hundred and thirty six"
"Fine, I'm sure I'll be ok now"
Zack inserted the number sixteen into the machine for his age, followed by his previous weight on 136 pounds. The machine read HEALTHY WEIGHT. He then stepped on. The scales shot to a result instantly - 157 pounds.
"Well, well...twenty one pounds in two months, you probably gained one and a half stone when you started working at Tony's four weeks ago. Man, check what the scale says!"
The words ALMOST OVERWEIGHT were in bright red letters above Zack's reading.
"So what, my extra pounds are part of me now.It'll be gone next cemester. Your turn, Mr Skinny..."
Chuckling, Cody inserted his money and got on the scale. He typed his age, and then his old weight of 128 pounds. The scale read ALMOST UNDERWEIGHT.
"See, I needed to gain a little anyway" smiled Cody, rubbing his gut. The scale went up to....- 143 pounds. Cody gulped nervously and waited for the machine reading. It came as BEYOND HEALTHY WEIGHT.
"Oh...errmmm....I must have taken it a little too far" groaned Cody, stepping off. He raised his shirt again and looked at his gut, concerned. His flat stomach wasn't there anymore, it had become bigger and more noticeable. But while Cody's sweater vest only revealed a trace of his overeating, Zack's T-shirt was under strain. It didn't quite cover him and it showed every pound of his weight gain.
"Not exactly super-fit are you?" said Zack.
"Oh shut up. My extra fifteen pounds are a little more spread out than your whopping twenty one"
"Hey, we've both gained more than a stone" snorted Zack. "If your not careful, you might get bigger!"
"That's never gonna happen. I'm not even gonna try and diet, being beyond healthy weight isn't that bad. I'll be in perfect shape for the swim tryouts for the races the city is having, the grand prize money is $1000"
"Whatever. Come on, let's go to Gradudats"

What happens next?
13111.title: Got Side Tracked at a Fast Food Place

131111.content:
Cody blanched as he looked at the price tag of some of the clothes at Gradudats. But, it was not only the prices worrying him; it was the waistbands of the clothes. They were not that stretchy, and Zack was larger than ever, so to see him pulling clothes off of the hangers and disappearing into the changing rooms with a waddle, worried Cody.

Pulling some of the clothes off of the hangers, he disappeared into the other changing room; striping down to his boxers - which clung tightly to him - he stood sideways in front of the full length mirror. His hair was longer than it was when he had taken the job at Tony's. It hung down the side of his chubby cheeked face in two blond curtains and a small double chin was making itself known on his face.

Two round, plump manboobs were beginning to push their way forward from his chest and a large belly - at least eight inches larger than before - curved forward from below them and met at his pelvis which led to two thick thighs. He could just see his feet; five thick fat filled toes.

Slowly, he pulled the trousers off of the hanger and slipped his feet into them; pulling them up his thighs, he took a deep breath and then let it out, before pulling the trousers over his bottom. Surprisingly, there was more stretch in them than he though there was and they fastened easily around his belly. To his immense happiness, the shirt was a little baggy and hid his rounding belly.

Picking up seven of the same outfits, he headed out, bought them and then returned to Zack's changing room. A pile of trousers - some with ripped seams and some with burst buttons - was piled up outside in a basker that had a sign reading Too Small above it.

"Hey, Zack, listen. I'm done. I've got my clothes. I'll see you at home, ok? Mum's making her fifteen cheese full fat lasagne."

"Ok, see you at dinner!" Grunted Zack. He heard Cody's heavy footfalls disappear as Cody left the shop. He pulled off the trousers, put on his own clothes, threw the trousers
into the basket and stalked out of the shop, annoyed at not being able to fit into clothes that Cody could.

As he passed a shop, his belly rumbled; a sign in the window read "Taste Tester Wanted"; after talking with Henry, the boss, and admitting his situation - that he already had a job at Tony's and after explaining what hours he worked there - it was decided that after he had finished at Tony's he would come here to taste the Brownies that this shop made.

"D'you want to start now?" Inquired Henry.

Zack's belly gave a very audible rumble and, salivating and noddng, he took a seat and dug in as soon as Henry put a bowl of brownies in front of him.

Sixteen bowls of brownies later, Zack reclined in the chair, both hands on his belly and his face covered in chocolate brownie remains.

"My god! You can eat!" Exclaimed Henry, shocked. "I think I did good in hiring you."

"Thanks!" Burped Zack. "C-Can I have another brownie for the journey home?"

"Sure." Henry handed him a brownie, helped him up, growning slightly under Zack's heavy glutted form. Watching him go, Henry smiled happily; if this kept up he'd make millions from that gluttonous pig.

-xXx-


Zack burped as he washed his face after returning to the suite; surprisingly, Cody wasn't there. The door slammed; Zack stuck his head out of the bathroom. Cody, his face caked in ice cream, was washing his face with the flannel in the sink.

"Been back to Tony's?"

"Yeah; I had a snack before coming home. You didn't spend all day in Gradudats, did you?"

"Course not." Replied Zack, crossing his arms over his chest, which made his still stuffed belly look bigger than ever and gave him time to think up a lie "I had a couple of hotdogs and went to the Arcade. I didn't win, naturally, but I had fun."

Zack didn't think that now was the time to tell Cody that he had a second job and decided to save it for later.

-xXx-


After eating seven helpings of lasagne each, Zack and Cody crawled into bed; Cody's creaked underneath him, but Zack's groaned alarmingly as he rolled onto his back, his big belly bulging into the air. While Cody had stuffed his belly full with 7,000 calories - enough for two fully grown men - Zack had stuffed his face with 14,000 calories.
Bellies bubbling to digest all the food they had stuffed into it, the two ever expanding twins fell asleep.
131111.title: They go to Gradudats, But Zack Has Trouble Find...

choices: At The Swim Meet Cody is 185 Pounds and Zack is 210 Pounds
At The Swim Meet Cody is Not 185 Pounds and Zack is 210 Pounds
1311111.content:
When the twins awoke four weeks later, it was a Sunday and officially two weeks until the swim meet, and neither twin was in peak condition. In fact, both twins were fatter than ever. Zack, who had done nothing to crub his appetite, snored as Cody was the first to climb out of bed.
Cody had remember his weight reading of BEYOND HEALTHY WEIGHT and had taken it to mean that he was in the Healthy Weight category, so while continuing his job at Tony's he had begun snacking on the side too. Yawning, stretching and scratching his belly, he gave a small burp - which was the remains of the five tiered chocolate cake he had scoffed before going to bed the previous night - and headed off to the bathroom. As he closed the door, it clunked slightly, causing Zack to wake up.

Cody stepped onto the scales; Carey, on a diet, had brought herself and the boys a talking scale that recorded each previous weight and said whether you were healthy weight, overweight or obese. Pressing the buttom that said CODY and typing in his previous weight of 143 pounds - which is what he had weight four weeks ago when he had last used the scales - he input his height of five foot five. The words "BEYOND HEALTHY WEIGHT" came from the scales. Cody pressed the button that said PROCEED and watched the numbers tick as the scale determined his weight. He watched the numbers rise 130...135...140... 145... 150... 155... 160...161...162...163...164. He stepped off, confused and the scales said "OVERWEIGHT"; how was it possible that he had gained twenty ones pounds in a month? From behind him, he heard Zack snort; stood in the doorway, Zack's larger-than-ever-frame gently thumped against the sides of the door. Working two jobs and snacking on the side had swelled Zack to his largest ever size.

"Alright then, fatty, YOU get on." Said Cody, putting both hands on his hips, which made his love handles look bigger than ever. "You've been eating enough at Tony's to feed three hippos."

"Alright, I will. I can't be more than 170 at most."

Zack stepped forward and onto the scales. He pressed the button that said ZACK and typed in his height of five foot four and his former weight of 157 pounds. The scale said "ALMOST OVERWEIGHT". Like Cody, Zack pressed the button that said PROCEED and watched the numbers rise. 140...145...150..155...160...165...170...175...180...185....186...187...< br />
Finally, the scales stopped and said "OBESE"; Cody snorted.

"So much for one seventy. Come on, let's get dressed. We've got to start training for the swim competition. You really need it." With that, Cody led his infinitely fatter twin out of the room. "We'll get a hamburger or two before we begin your diet."

"My diet? You're overweight too! You need one just as much as me!"

"I'm just a bit chubby, that's all. The weight'll be gone before the swim meet; I won't even have to work for it. You, on the other hand, will."

"Yeah? I bet you, Cody, that you're at least 185 by the time of the swim meet."

"As if! Alright, I'll take that bet! If I'm not 185, you diet, alright? If I am, which I won't be, then I'll cut back a bit. Ok?"

"Deal."

Cody burped and shook his brother's hand. The two got dressed, stuffed their faces with ten helpings of breakfast, and waddled off to Tony's. As Cody headed home from Tony's, Zack headed to Henry's Brownie Barn.

Once again, both bloated teenagers, after a day of stuffing, fell to sleep very quickly.

What happens next?
1311111.title: Four weeks later

choices: Cody is 185 pounds and his swimming trunks fit, barely.
Cody is over 185 pounds and his swimming trunks do not fit at all.
13111111.content:
Today was the day of the swim meet, and neither twin had given up their suite life...

Cody, who looked bigger than ever, scratched his fat ass as Zack was the first to get out of bed.
Yawning, and trying to get his hair to look good, he headed off to the bathroom.

Zack stepped onto the scales and watched the numbers tick as the scale determined his weight. He watched the numbers rise 180...185...190... 206... 210. He stepped off, confused and the scales said "OBESE"; the same as it said 4 weeks ago.

Suddenly he realised: He hadn't yet tried on his swimming trunks! He quickly waddled over to the dresser and grabbed his trunks. He checked the size, it was anX L
"Let's hope this fits..." Zack whispered to himself
After stripping down to his underwear, he looked at himself in the bathroom mirror. His face was a lot fatter than 4 weeks ago. His double chin almost swallowed his neck, his manboobs were bigger than his closed fists. Zack grabbed one, it felt jiggly and warm. He then moved his chubby fingers down to his belly, which hung over his underwear. He then played a little bit with his belly button and finally, proceeded to try on his trunks. He could get him past his thighs, but his belly was a 'bigger' problem. his midsection was never going to be contained by an XL size swimming trunk. However, rather amazingly, Zack managed to get it to fit. He turned towards the mirror. The seams looked like they were ready to rip, and the trunks really made his overhang stand out more.
"Well, It'll have to do, once I have enough money I can get a bigger one..."
Zack waddled over to his bedroom and was about to wake Cody up, wanting him to also try on his swimming trunks, it was the day of the swim meet after all...

What happens?
